dialogues.speaker: NEON SIGN
dialogues.text: The N and the E are not working. So it reads the PR IC mo ROOMS TO RENT BY DAY, WEEK, MONTH. KITCHENETTES. The Prin Motel has passed its prime. A few beat up cars are parked outside rooms. We CRANE DOWN to ROOM SEVEN. Curtains clos but someone is holding it open a crack, looking out. We P in CLOSE TO THE WINDOW and the EYE looking over the parki lot. Then the curtain closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeling flowered wallpaper, ultra-cheap furniture. The ma moving away from the window is RODRIGUEZ. He is slender,  sports a thin mustache, hair slicked straight back. He's his late thirties. Slightly nervous. Another man sits on the couch, looking at a magazine. He forty, solidly built. His name is FRANK DIVINCI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says here they got slips in Honolulu.  325 a month. Utilities included.  That's not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I gotta get at least a forty  footer. It'll handle rough water  better and I'll need the room if I'm  gonna live on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez stands up, moves back to the window. Divinci lo up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you can think about Hawaii now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My heart's in Hawaii.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never been there. How can your  heart be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're tellin' me there's no place  you'd rather be other than here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm saying I just don't know how  you can think about Hawaii right  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was in Hawaii right now, I  wouldn't be thinking about here. See  the difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not in Hawaii, I'm here.  But I don't want to be here, I want  to be in Hawaii. I can't be in Hawaii,  therefore I think about it so as to  not get depressed about being here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm here, I know I'm here, I  don't like being here, but I can't  be anyplace else because I look around  and I see all this shit. How do you  get around that?! That's what I'm  asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci nods. Rodriguez looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time. No more Hawaii, okay?  Focus on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Aloha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez shakes his head, exasperated, and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Aloha my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor side of town. A few old cars parked on the street. S buildings vacant. A LATE MODEL WHITE CADILLAC cruises pas We HEAR LOUD RAP MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIONEL HUDD drives. Hudd is thirty. African American. The MUSIC is loud. His clothes lean to African roots. A WOMAN sits next to the passenger window. Her name is CYNTHIA WE Cynthia is thirty-five, dressed in short provocative skir tight top. A little too much make-up. She's lead a hard l She glances at Hudd. Hudd glances at her, looks down at h skirt hiked up on her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left at the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudd's eyes linger on her thighs for a moment, then he tu his attention back to driving, tapping along with the hea bass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac pulls into the parking lot. Parks in front o room SEVEN. Hudd gets out, looks around. Cynthia gets out leads him to SEVEN. Knocks. The curtains pull back. Divinci looks at Hudd and Cynthia She nods to him. The door unlocks and opens. Cynthia enters. Hudd looks around again. Then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci waits at the door. He and Hudd eye each other as  Hudd enters the room. Divinci looks out, making sure no o has followed, then shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you don't mind me checkin' you  for weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yes I mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci hesitates. This could break the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want no man handlin'  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudd looks at Cynthia. The suggestion is taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Check him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudd spreads his legs, lifts his arms. Cynthia would rath not have the job, but there's no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lotta good hidin' places on this  body. Check good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia runs her hands over Hudd, checking pockets, pants sleeves. Finally coming to his crotch. Hudd smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. It's loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia has heard it all before. She's not squeamish in t least and she gives him a good going over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles back at Hudd. Then moves away, sits on the cou and seductively crosses her legs. Divinci, satisfied, pulls a PLASTIC BAG packed tight with COCAINE out of his pocket, tosses it to Hudd. Hudd sits on the couch, opens the bag, sticks his finger and tastes the contents. But never takes his eyes off Div

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad, not bad. Any more where  this came from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe we talk again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudd stands, unzips his pants. Reaches in to grab his coc but instead, pulls out a stack of MONEY. Inch thick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you there was a lotta good hidin'  places on this body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudd hands the money to Divinci and pockets the plastic b Then crosses to the door. Glances back at Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet you gotta lotta nice hidin'  places, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Hudd smiles and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudd gets into his Cadillac, pulls out of the motel parki lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted. No one on the street this late. Several of the  buildings are boarded up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudd drives. No music this time. His attitude has changed More serious. LIGHTS in the REAR VIEW MIRROR. Coming up f Hudd watches as the car pulls around to pass. He glances at the CAR as it pulls past him, but all we SE is the FLASH OF A BLAST FROM A GUN. Front WINDOW EXPLODIN

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: swerves into a parked car. The OTHER CAR -- a BUICK REGAL screeches to a stop next to it. ONE MAN gets out. Moving  quickly to the Cadillac. It's dark, difficult to see. He  carries a SMITH AND WESSON .44. Opens the door. He's wear PLASTIC GLOVES. Hudd is dead, slumped against the passenger door. The man reaches in, turns off the engine, grabs the plastic bag o cocaine. And now we see it's Divinci.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez is the driver. Anxious. Engine running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci dashes back to the Buick, hops in. Rodriguez floo it.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUICK
dialogues.text: tears off down the dark street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a great part of the city. Apartment buildings line bo sides of the street. An alley runs between two of the  buildings. A TAXI pulls up in front. HEADLIGHTS SHINING o MAN passed out in the street. Cynthia exits the taxi. The taxi pulls away. She glances the man passed out in the street. His clothes are ragged. He's filthy. His face covered in  beard and greasy dirty hair. Hard to tell how old he is.  Maybe forty. Maybe eighty. Who knows? His hand clutches a bottle in a bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Joe, wake up. Get outa the street  before you get run over. Joe, wake  up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nudges him with her foot. The man groans, rolls back. Dead drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in the street, Joe. Get outa  the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man, JOE, is silent for a moment, then he starts to c toward the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other way, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe turns his crawl toward the curb. Cynthia watches him a moment. He is truly pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, Joe. Maybe you're better  off right there. I don't think you'd  even feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia enters the building next to the alley.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: asleep. The room is dark. We HEAR a door open and close.  Cynthia wakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci crosses to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes, trying to go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a sleeping pill. There's some  in my purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want your money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia's eyes open and she looks up at Divinci. He's smi holding up FIVE ONE HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already worked for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci unzips his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a bonus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci smiles. Cynthia snatches the money. Divinci start to undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't my fault. This is a failure  of our educational system. If you  hadn't fallen through the cracks and  dropped outa school, you wouldn't be  here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your excuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia just stares at him for a long beat. Then she unbu Divinci's pants.

dialogues.speaker: KEY
dialogues.text: A door is pushed open. Rodriguez enters his one bedroom  apartment. Starts to shut the door when TWO MEN appear fr the shadows. The first is short, well dressed. His name i VIC. The second is large, heavy-set, shaved head. His nam is CUTLESS SUPREME. Cutless Supreme is not a man to be me with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keepin' some late hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez looks at Cutless Supreme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you doin'? What're my  neighbors gonna think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize. I understand your  concerns. But you must understand  that, unlike a bank, I cannot rely  on a late fee as sufficient  encouragement to repay one's debts.  I am forced to employ the likes of  Mr. Cutless Supreme, whom I might  add, contributes significantly to my  overhead. I am the real loser here.  And I am concerned about your  sincerity in repaying the twenty- seven thousand, nine hundred forty- two dollar gambling debt that is one  week past due. What can you do to  reassure me of your good intentions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can make your life fuckin' miserable  that's what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at me. Do I have a wife and  three kids? Do I have a good job at  IBM? Am I a handsome guy? No, no and  no. I loan money at excessively high  interest rates to pricks like you  who can't control their urges to  lose big money playing cards and  then I am forced to stay up all night  trying to convince them that I have  needs, too. The point of which is, I  already have a fuckin' miserable  life. So don't threaten me you lousy  bag of cat shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez steps toward Vic, but Cutless Supreme slides in between them. Rodriguez isn't going to win this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm askin' is that you be  responsible. Is that unreasonable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez backs off, hesitates as he runs over his option There aren't any. He reaches into his pocket, pulls out s of his night's earnings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four thousand is all I got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am proportionally reassured. You  purchased yourself an extension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic takes the money, heads for the street. Rodriguez watc Vic walk away. Cutless Supreme watches Rodriguez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutless Supreme, what kind of fuckin'  idiot name is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the car my daddy stole to  take my momma to the hospital, but  the cops stopped him and shot him  dead in an alley before he could  explain. I was born in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez glares at Cutless Supreme, then he shuts the do

dialogues.speaker: CREDIT SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: CRIME SCENE PHOTOGRAPHS -- Dead drug dealers lying where  they were shot. Overlapping CLOSE-UPS of EVIDENCE TAGS an SHELVING filled with EVIDENCE from hundreds of crime scen And CLOSE-SHOTS of CRIME SCENES -- chalk outlines -- bull shells - bloody foot prints. And finally CRIME SCENE TAPE The BLACK AND WHITE fades back into COLOR --

dialogues.speaker: YELLOW CRIME SCENE TAPE
dialogues.text: surrounding the CADILLAC. We PULL BACK, revealing COPS  controlling the area. It's early morning. A FEW PEOPLE ha stopped to watch. But this is not a high traffic area. ANOTHER CAR pulls up. Unmarked. Two men get out. We FOLLO BEHIND THEM as they approach the Cadillac and PATROLMAN  MAHONEY, who knows them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another day, another body. Where you  wanna start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like. Could be gang related.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we SEE THE TWO MEN from the unmarked car. It's DI and RODRIGUEZ. Suit and ties. They act like they own the  area. And they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happened sometime last night, early  morning, two, three o'clock. African- American male, looks like in his  thirties. But even that's a guess.  Half his head is on the upholstery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any witnesses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure, hundreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bloody scene is untouched. Hudd's body is where it fe on the seat. Dried blood everywhere. Divinci looks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' Animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVIDENCE ROOM. Behind a locked fenced in area. A DESK OFF checks in and out all evidence. He is twenty-eight, wears glasses, very clean cut. TWO DETECTIVES are checking in  evidence as Divinci walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...three shotgun shells, twelve gauge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Desk Officer checks in the evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three shotgun shells, twelve gauge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two detectives wave hellos to Divinci as he approache

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you got a gang related. Lucky  guy, Divinci. You get all the pretty  ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One less drug store on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the world is a safer place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Desk Officer buzzes Divinci through the door. Divinci crosses to the --

dialogues.speaker: EVIDENCE STORAGE ROOM
dialogues.text: -- filled with shelves. Stacked with evidence from on-goi investigations. And the shelves are full of guns, knives, bloody gloves, masks, shoes, etc. Divinci looks around, then removes the PACKAGE OF COCAINE and the .44 from his pockets and places them back on one the shelves. CASE NUMBER C-549087. One thing about the .4 which we can see now -- a BLACK STAIN on the metal of the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desks, phones, computers, typewriters and HOMICIDE DETECT Some witnesses being interviewed. Rodriguez is on the pho at his desk. He's in the middle of an interview as he fil out one of the many forms that complicate his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) -- a green car... you know what  make... Maybe a Ford, uh-huh. You  didn't see the license, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci comes back to his desk, next to Rodriguez. Rodrig looks up. Divinci gives him a confident smile and brushes his hands together -- clean hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah, no, I understand, it was dark...  Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci sits at his desk. He pulls an ADVERTISEMENT for a FOOT SPORT FISHING BOAT out of his desk. He holds it up t Rodriguez, points to the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna go for a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) You think you could describe the  driver? (covers phone; to  Divinci) You bought it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As of last night, I've got the down.  Just picture me under swayin' palms  with a Mai Tai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can HEAR someone describing a felon over the phone, bu Rodriguez isn't listening. He's looking at the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Uh-huh. (covers phone) You're gonna buy it, no shit. When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a phone call away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci picks up the phone, starts to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really great, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci smiles. Rodriguez suddenly realizes the person on the other end of the phone has stopped talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to phone) Uh-huh, okay... how tall was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy set man in his fifties approaches -- CAPTAIN  HENDERSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got primary on the drug related  this morning on 27th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm workin' it up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your second? (Divinci points at  Rodriguez) In my office. Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Henderson doesn't wait for a response. He heads f the office -- an inner office of glass and wood. Divinci looks at Rodriguez, who is suddenly a little nerv We can HEAR the PERSON OVER THE PHONE that he's talking t but he's no longer interested and hangs up on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci motions "keep calm."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henderson is hanging up his coat as Divinci and Rodriguez enter. They aren't the only ones in the office. RICHARD S thirty-two, trim, short cut hair, suit, is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detectives Divinci and Rodriguez,  this is Richard Simms. He's with the  D.E.A. He wants to ask you some  questions about your case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the occasion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get an i.d. on the victim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're waitin' for prints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci pulls out his note pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car was registered to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Anchor Imports. 81 El Dorado.  Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you got all this, what d'you want  from us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The man in the car is Lionel Hudd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little incensed) How d'you know that? (to Henderson) What's goin' on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudd was DEA, undercover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez and Divinci take the news like a sledgehammer. their frozen expressions we HEAR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was workin' a case on syndicate  distribution of drugs on the south  side. But every dealer we tagged  kept getting killed. He finally got  a lead on a girl -- Hudd was a friend  of mine... I'm gonna nail the  sonuvabitch who killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat on Rodriguez and Divinci, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do everything we can to help.

dialogues.speaker: THE UNMARKED POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: screeching around a corner and up a drive into a VACANT L The car skids to a stop and Rodriguez gets out of the dri side, slamming the door and storming off. He's out of his mind. Divinci gets out quickly, follows him. Rodriguez is so fi up and scared he can't stop moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIT, FUCK, SHIT, JESUS CHRIST!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE'RE DEAD, WE'RE FUCKING DEAD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUT UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK, FUCK, FUCK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci catches Rodriguez, tries to stop him from flailin about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOP IT! YOU HEAR ME, RIGHT NOW,  STOP IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOD, GOD, THIS IS REALLY FUCKIN' OUT  OF CONTROL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez tries to push Divinci away, but Divinci holds o They struggle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LET GO OF ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- pushing, shoving, falling to the dirt. Divinci jumps o top of him, pulling his pistol and shoving it into Rodrig mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and listen to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez glares up at Divinci.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could be watchin' us right now  you asshole. So fuckin' shape up!  You got it?! (nothing from Rodriguez) I want you to nod!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes Rodriguez a moment, but he nods. Divinci pulls h gun out of Rodriguez' mouth, gets off him and holsters hi pistol. Rodriguez is scared to death, not of Divinci, of mess they're in. He just lies in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez starts to get to his feet. Divinci grabs him, y him up. Pushes him to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move back to the car. Rodriguez gets back into the  driver's seat. Divinci moves around to the passenger side Gets in, slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit silently in the car for a moment in the middle o the vacant lot. Breathing hard. Dirty. After a beat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no fuckin' reason to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez turns slowly and looks at Divinci incredulously

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fuckin' reason to panic? Did you  say no fuckin' reason to panic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop being an idiot! We're the cops  on the case. It's our case. We are  going to find the fuckin' killers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE'RE THE FUCKIN' KILLERS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when does that matter?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez stares at Divinci for a beat, then we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez and Divinci are sitting on the car, each with a beer and sharing a bottle of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All they want is someone to go down  for the crime, right? Do we care who  goes down for the crime? Fuck no. As  long as someone goes down for the  crime. It's a slot that's gotta be  filled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez is calmer, but still something bothers him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We killed a cop, doesn't that bother  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it bothers me. What d'you  want me to do, turn myself in? Well  I'm not. That's the risk we take  everyday, somebody might pop us,  especially undercover like that. So  he got popped. It happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not by other cops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I patted him down! He wasn't wearin'  a wire, he had no badge, no gun, how  was I supposed to know?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I feel just as bad as you do,  but we gotta start thinkin' about us  here. The important thing is we don't  lose control of the case. We can  never lose control of the case.  Whatever evidence there is goes  through us. We lay down the trail.  Make it nice and logical. We're the  teachers and two and two can add up  to five if it's our classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talkin' about, are you  sayin' we stick somebody with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evidence points wherever we want it  to point. Shit, we can provide so  much evidence, even the asshole we  pick will think he fuckin' killed  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got some asshole in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't worry. We'll find a killer.  There's lots of 'em out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE AFRICAN AMERICAN YOUTHS, all in their twenties, are hanging on a street corner. Talking. Normal street traffi They give a long hard look to an ATTRACTIVE AFRICAN AMERI WOMAN who walks past. A little chatter. The UNMARKED CAR suddenly screeches to the curb. The blac youths scatter quickly as Divinci jumps out and goes afte the tallest of the three. His name is JAMES. Rodriguez gu the car and gives chase on wheels. James darts across traffic. Divinci running hard after hi Rodriguez spins the car in a u-turn. Racing after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James darts down the alley. Narrow, dark, lined with tras bins. Divinci turns into the alley, but he isn't going to catch him. James is almost to the end when the car turns into the al skidding to a stop. Rodriguez jumps out, gun leveled at J No where for him to go. He slows down. Rodriguez moves in from his front, Divinci runs up from behind. James is  disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell'd I do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci removes the PACKAGE OF COCAINE and the .44 from t shelf. CASE NUMBER C-549087.

dialogues.speaker: THE .44
dialogues.text: SLIDING across a table to James, who stops it with his ri hand. Divinci and Rodriguez are across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't my gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never is, is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't my fuckin' gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves the gun back. Divinci stops it with his arm, ca not to touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got your fuckin' prints on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James quickly realizes what they've done. He lunges for t gun, but Divinci picks it up quickly with a pencil throug the trigger guard. James glares at them with murderous in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you Friday night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friday night... last Friday night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you think I did went down  last Friday night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better have a good alibi, James, or  it's good ali bye-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then James smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in jail you assholes. Check it  out. (starts to laugh) All night. What a couple a dickheads!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez and Divinci are silent.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: KICKED IN on a grungy small apartment. Divinci and Rodrig burst in, guns drawn. Scaring the shit out of an HISPANIC MAN (CORTEZ) and his half-naked GIRLFRIEND as they watch  television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOBODY MOVE! HANDS IN THE AIR! NOW!  MOVE IT!

dialogues.speaker: THE .44
dialogues.text: SLIDING across the table back to Rodriguez and Divinci. C sits across from them. Wearing white t-shirt, baggy pants Tattoos on his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't my gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Got your prints on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands; angry) You fuck, I ain't never seen that  gun before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you last Friday night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I wanna talk to a lawyer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just want they wanted to hear. No alibi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawyer's not gonna help you, Cortez.  All the evidence we got points right  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez stares at them for a moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you say last Friday night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cortez smiles and pulls up his shirt, revealing a long sc across his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intensive Care, you pindejo fuckin'  gutter shits. And Thursday night,  and Saturday, too. I just fucking  got out this morning.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: SLAMMING INTO A WALL, hitting hard, falling back to the d garbage covered alley. He's about twenty-seven, thin, blo hair tied in a pony tail. He wears a flannel shirt, jeans boots. He doesn't want to fight. His name is DAVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, alright... shit. I  ain't gonna fight you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at Divinci and Rodriguez moving toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave is behind the desk handling the .44 with no apparent problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't my gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what they all say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish it was. No better gun than Smitty  and Wes .44 mag with serial numbers  filed off. (opens cylinder) Got any bullets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci walks around, holds out his hand for the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did I kill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you last Friday night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, what's my alibi right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave spits on the gun, wipes off his prints with his shir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was breakin' and entering. Jewelry  store on seventh and Front, about  nine o'clock. Not even close to your  jurisdiction. I got the rocks to  prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the gun, clean of prints onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I can't help ya. But one to  five is better than ten to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci and Rodriguez stare at Dave. They are not happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in plastic pages. A BINDER full of criminal portraits. Di is going through one book. Rodriguez searches another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montrose LaJolla...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pulled him in last year for knifing  that dealer on 32nd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Almost killed him, remember?  He'd be good. (calls out to ANOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody seen Montrose LaJolla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. His life partner killed  him in a Domestic D about a month  ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez suddenly slams his book shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci looks at him. Rodriguez is angry, tense. Divinci  gives him a look telling him this is not the time and pla for a discussion on this topic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't gonna work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci leans toward Rodriguez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody said it was gonna be easy.  But let's not advertise our despair...  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS. Divinci picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Divinci.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Henderson is sitting behind his desk. Divinci and Rodriguez are in front of him. Rodriguez is trying to hid his nervousness. Divinci is absolutely cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our case! Not the goddamn  DEA's!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not fuckin' magicians! What  the hell is three days?! This is a  goddamn murder case! It takes a little  bit of goddamn time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a Federal Undercover Officer  goes down, it's never a fuckin' murder  case! I don't like the DEA on my ass  any better than you like 'em on yours.  But this is personal for them and  they want answers. Forget your other  cases and get something, anything  that I can give to them. The last  thing I want is the goddamn F.B.I.  on my back, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci and Rodriguez are quiet for a beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a couple leads. We need a  little more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hold 'em off much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no fuckin' way to run an  investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you both something, if  you don't solve this quick, they're  gonna start askin' why? And they'll  be lookin' to blame somebody in this  department. So my advise to you is,  get something fuckin' fast or turn  over what you've got and get outa  the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez and Divinci are quiet for a moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time we got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple days. The funeral's this  afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Agent Hudd. Simms wants you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? We didn't know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do I know?! It's DEA,  it's their thing. You're the cops on  the case, I suppose they want you to  know what a great guy Hudd was so  you'll work all that harder to find  his killer. Just go. It'll reassure  'em how much you care and keep 'em  off my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOURNERS gathered around the grave site. WIFE in tears. M in tears. The men trying their best to hold up. Beyond th family, DEA AGENTS. Simms among them. A show of support a solidarity. A REVEREND delivering --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and it is too easy to say that he  was a good man in his job because he  gave more than most. And it's too  easy to say that he was a good man  in his community because he gave  more than others. And it's too easy  to say he was a good man at home  with his family because he was always  there when they needed him. Special  Agent Lionel Hudd was not just a  good man, he was an extraordinary  man. And his death shall not be in  vain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDS Divinci and Rodriguez at the back. Rodriguez looks nervous. Divinci notices. Their conversation is qui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't Humpty Dumpty on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your cracks are startin' to show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering) Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci sees Simms approaching from the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your balance. Here comes the  King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez glances toward Simms as he walks up. The  conversation is quiet. Not wanting to disturb the ceremon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad you came... Anything break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci glances at Rodriguez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' to brag about. But we've got  a couple new leads we're followin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Look, normally we'd be all over  this, but your Captain seems to think  you can do the job. It's your  territory. I guess you know it better  than anybody. And that can be worth  a lot. But you understand... we won't  wait forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci is pissed. He doesn't like Simms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just outa curiosity... What happened  to his backup? You guys use backup  on undercover don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a new lead. Hudd was afraid  backup would blow his cover. He was  supposed to check in ten minutes  after the deal went down. He never  checked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want this one as bad as you do. A  cop's a cop. We're in this together,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms stares at Rodriguez and Divinci for a moment, then returns his attention to the ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I asked you to come here.  Just so you knew that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez and Divinci walk down the street, hot dogs in h returning to their car parked curbside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't have backup. You believe  that?! Jesus what a dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we should criticize  that particular decision of his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what the reasons are,  you don't play Lone Fuckin' Ranger  on a drug buy. You're just askin'  for it. That's all I'm sayin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust those bastards. They're  not waitin' for us. That's bullshit.  They're runnin' their own  investigation. I know it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let 'em. The gun, the coke came from  evidence. The car came from impound.  So what's to find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm afraid of. There's  nothing for them to find. We were  too good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what're you worried about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody is that fuckin' good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci looks at Rodriguez, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except us.

dialogues.speaker: STRIPPER
dialogues.text: bumping and grinding her way through her performance. We  don't see her face yet. Just her body. G-string and skin  tight tank top. LOUD MUSIC. MEN in the audience appreciat The room is smoky. LIGHTS swirl over the stage. The tank comes off. WHISTLES and CHEERS. And now we see the dancer it's CYNTHIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia moves down the hall in her g-string and high heel She enters the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci is sitting in the only chair in the cramped littl room. He's going through her purse. Cynthia stops when sh sees him, then shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is breaking and entering,  isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work homicide, I don't deal with  that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts on robe) Learn anything you didn't already  have on file?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You surprise me sometimes.  Here I think you're just a hard case  and I discover you've got a heart of  gold. (holds up her drivers  license) You're an organ donor. That's really  nice. The only problem is, they'll  never use your best parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make sure you get them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't get me wrong. I was just  surprised that we had something in  common... Besides what we have in  common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do everybody a favor, if you're gonna  donate your heart, make sure it goes  to science. Most people want one  that beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia... pretty name. What do the  first three letters spell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get so clever. It's out of  character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci and Cynthia are lying in bed. Divinci has his arm around her, but he's staring at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so interesting up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why's it got all your attention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinkin', that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci looks at Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I was thinkin' about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't waste your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it gonna get us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I got plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna hear 'em. Plans just  make you think somethin's gonna get  better. I'm fine now. I don't need  to get screwed up waitin' for  something good to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to know, love is  important to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But more important is loyalty. Nothing  is more important than that. Not  love, not anything. Because loyalty  is about respect. You can talk about  love all you want, but without respect  it's empty. I mean the first thing  that goes in a marriage is respect.  And once it's gone, forget the love.  So I am telling you, I am loyal to  you. Like I'm loyal to my partner.  We are closer than blood. And I trust  him with my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia didn't really expect this from Divinci. She's  actually, despite herself, a little touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why're you telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you asked if I was thinkin'  about us and I said I wasn't, I just  want you to know that I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't ask me to marry you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Why aren't more women like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci leans in and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci exits the building. Starts to cross the street to his car parked on the opposite side when he HEARS SOMETHI BEHIND him. He turns, instantly reaching for his pistol. A drunk staggers out of the alley -- looks like he has a in his hand. Divinci instinctively raises his gun to shoot when -- THE LIGHT -- catches the object in the drunk's hand -- a  BROWN BOTTLE, the neck sticking ahead like the barrel of gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowers gun) You fuckin' idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drunk stops when he hears the voice. Looks through hi matted greasy hair that cascades in front of his eyes. No we recognize Joe. Divinci turns away, disgusted. Opens his car door, then s Caught in a thought. He turns back and looks at Joe again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stumbles back into the DARKNESS OF THE ALLEY. Lies do next to a trash bin. LIGHTS suddenly illuminate Joe. Joe  squints as a CAR moves right up to him. Joe shields the l with an arm. We HEAR the DOOR OPEN and CLOSE, then Divinci bends down  into the LIGHT. He is wearing a BASEBALL CAP backwards on his head. And GLOVES on his hands. He reaches inside Joe' JACKET POCKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What've we got here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out the Smith and Wesson .44. Divinci looks at J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you last Friday night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, Joe looks up at Divinci through matted hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci drives. Joe up front. In an alcoholic daze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks at Divinci. Having trouble focusing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get the gun, Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks down at his hands -- he's holding the .44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was in your pocket, Joe, your  coat pocket. You must keep it for  protection, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do, Joe. Everybody needs  protection. Especially a guy like  you lives on the street, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe just stares at the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it back in your pocket, Joe. You  don't have to worry about me, I'm  not gonna hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe puts the gun into his jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LOCATION of HUDD'S MURDER. The street is empty. Quiet Divinci stops his car next to where Hudd died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is asleep, leaning against the window. Divinci reache across and yanks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, Joe! I want you to look at  something. Out the window, Joe. Look  out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's eyes open. Divinci forces his head to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where it happened, Joe. I  want you to remember it. This is  where you killed him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe tries to turn to Divinci, but Divinci holds his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember it now? How you shot  him through the head? You remember  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lets go of Joe) You will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci slams his foot down on the accelerator and --

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: -- tears off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
dialogues.text: asleep. Alone in a double bed. The PHONE RINGS. Rodriguez startles awake. Catches the phone on the second ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: DIVINCI
dialogues.text: Divinci on the phone in the f.g. Joe is passed out on the bed in the b.g. The room is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that any way to answer the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci, shit! It's quarter to six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what time it is, I'm not the  one in bed. I need the photos of the  scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a suspect. But he can't remember  all the details. He needs a little  help. And I thought, since you're my  partner, you might jump at the  opportunity to lend me a fuckin'  hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez sits up in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't remember last Friday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't remember a lotta Fridays.  Bring the shots and pick up a fifth  of Vodka. (glances at Joe) Make it two.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: asleep on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to get up, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci slaps him. Joe's eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to look at something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is still dark. Curtains drawn. We now see Rodrig He's wearing a black sock cap and gloves. He hands Divinc POLICE PHOTOGRAPHS of the car, the street, the victim -- murder scene. Divinci pulls Joe into a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the guy and the street and  the car. You remember how you shot  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stares at the photographs and starts to shake his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember? That's not what  you told me last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you remember you can have a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks at the bottle Rodriguez holds out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you gotta remember how you saw  him driving toward you and you were  in the street and you were afraid he  was going to hit you so you had to  shoot to protect yourself. You  remember now don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stares at the photographs for a moment, then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where's your gun, Joe, where do  you keep your gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe thinks a moment, then reaches into his coat pocket an pulls out the .44. Divinci hands Joe the bottle and Joe  drinks. We PUSH IN on the BOTTLE OF VODKA as the liquid d away and we CLOSE IN TIGHT until we can SEE LIONEL HUDD'S FACE as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudd dead. Blood on the windows. The street. Joe is drunk again. In a haze. Starts to lift the bottle. Rodriguez pu it away. Rodriguez and Divinci always stay behind Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't have a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do. In your pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Joe, it's tough to remember  things you don't wanna remember.  What about your last name, Joe. You  got a last name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks up as if trying to remember. Or trying not to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Joe, everybody's got a last  name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with us, Joe. We're trying  to help you. What's your last goddamn  name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez suddenly smacks Joe on the side of the head whe he tries to look back. Joe is surprised by the blow. Divi pushes Rodriguez back. Shakes his head telling him to bac off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joe; friendly) Come on, we're all tired here, Joe.  Just give us your last name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Okay, fine, what's in a name? But  you remember the gun, right, in your  pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you remember that you told me  you thought he was going to hit you,  right? That's why you shot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci looks at Rodriguez. Rodriguez nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it happen, Joe, tell me how it  happened. (prompting) You saw him driving toward you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I saw him driving toward me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: driving. The night that he was shot. He looks ahead into darkness of the street. Suddenly he SEES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN standing in the street ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: HUDD
dialogues.text: smiles and turns toward the man in the street.

dialogues.speaker: A .44
dialogues.text: is pulled from a jacket pocket, lifted toward the APPROAC CAR. The gun is in the hands of Joe. He is scared. The  HEADLIGHTS COMING RIGHT AT HIM. He aims and FIRES the gun

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT WINDOW
dialogues.text: SHATTERS. And the car swerves to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe watches from the street, then looks at the .44 in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE THE MOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Rodriguez leans into Joe who is now sitting on the edge o the bed, looking down at the .44 in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is in the street again. He doesn't know what he did.

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE THE MOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Divinci leans close to Joe from behind now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Joe can imagine it. We PUSH INTO JOE'S EYES.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE STREET
dialogues.text: as Joe turns and runs. As fast as he can away from the de He looks back over his shoulder, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to...

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE THE MOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Joe is staring at the gun. Divinci and Rodriguez watch hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was going to hit me... I was  scared... he was going to hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez looks at Divinci.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I...

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: AIMS the gun again at the APPROACHING CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we HEAR the GUN SHOT AGAIN, shattering the silence as

dialogues.speaker: THE SMOKING .44
dialogues.text: held by Joe's hand, which is held by Divinci's gloved han Divinci has held Joe's finger on the trigger and pulled i The gunshot is deadened in the old building. Joe is lying the back seat of a car, passed out, with Divinci holding .44 in his hand. The back door is open. The engine is run

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva nice shot, Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci pulls the 44. out of Joe's hand, then shuts the d gets into the front. The car pulls away, exiting the  warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: HAND
dialogues.text: signing a name at the bottom of a paper -- Joe. Beneath i is the type written name: JOE DOE. We PULL BACK and see i Joe signing a typewritten page as Divinci and Rodriguez w Joe is a mess. When he finishes he pushes the paper away puts his head down on the table. Divinci picks up the pap and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small yellow Toyota with a bashed up left fender pulls the curb. Cynthia gets out lugging her purse and a bag of groceries. We HEAR ANOTHER CAR DOOR SHUT. She turns. Divi is walking across the street from his car toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the middle of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci gives her a look as he takes the grocery bag from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci leads the way into the apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia opens the door, pulls the key out of the lock as  Divinci enters behind her with the groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, I need the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts the door. Divinci deposits the bag on the table Cynthia picks it up, moves into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a deal. Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got perishables, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia enters the kitchen and Divinci follows. Cynthia s unloading the groceries, putting the milk, eggs, etc. int the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy we did the last deal with is  dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia turns suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody popped him that night,  probably when he tried to unload the  stuff. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, does anybody --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Don't worry, there's no connection.  We got the guy who did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared the hell outa me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just need you to do one thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci and Rodriguez are moving down a hallway with Cynt She's nervous. Wants very much not to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be third from the left. Don't  fuck up. Third from the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'm I supposed to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look at 'em and then look at  the man the third from the left and  say, It's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll say, Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you say, Absolutely. No question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all I need to do right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a signed confession. You  i.d. him, he's goin' straight into  the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. But this is it. I'm not  doin' anything more than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's a done deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROWS of seats face a small platform. The LINEUP WALL is  striped with horizontal lines with HEIGHT NUMBERS. The  brightly lighted lineup is separated from the gallery, wh is in the dark. UNIFORMED GUARDS are on hand to make sure there is no  discussion, verbal or otherwise, between accused and witn SIX MEN file onto the platform. All shady characters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop and face front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six men obey. A couple keep their heads down. The oth squint from the bright lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lift your heads, look straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads are lifted. Eyes front. But we only recognize one o them, standing third from the left. It's Joe. Divinci, Rodriguez and Cynthia are in the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time. Try and remember his  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia counts three from the left and... wait a minute. looks more closely. Just to be sure. Rodriguez and Divinc watch her. She's obviously putting on a good show. Then s turns to Divinci, sitting next to her and whispers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci is caught a little of guard -- he didn't expect a private conversation, nor does he want one for fear of it looking like he's coaching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can identify the man --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper) I know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell us which one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, frustrated, gives Divinci a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I fucking know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci still isn't sure what's gotten into her. Rodrigue looks over, a little annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no problem! (to Cynthia; pointedly) Do you see him up there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside) You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci is losing his patience. He doesn't want to blow t whole thing now, not in front of guards and police person The Guards are beginning to wonder what the hell's going So are the MEN in the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come on, do it or don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci leans in close to her. We can HEAR GRUMBLING from the men on the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick the asshole out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia starts to protest again, but she suddenly feels  Divinci's hand grip her arm. He's had enough. Cynthia get the message. And while keeping her eyes locked on Divinci she says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third man from the left.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: squints against the harsh light, trying to see into the r as if he recognized the voice.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Rodriguez, Divinci and Cynthia move briskly down the hall None happy about what just happened. The conversation is  strained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind telling me what that was  all about?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know him. He hangs around my  building. He lives in the alley or  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez looks at Divinci. Is this a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think people that hang  around your neighborhood can kill  somebody. Well let me tell you  something. You don't live in a great  fuckin' neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci pulls a paper from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sign the goddamn paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You picked a man out of a lineup,  you have to sign that you did that  so they don't think we made it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia just stares at Rodriguez for a beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now why the hell would they think  something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said all I had to do was pick  him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is part of it. Just sign it and  you're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you're so sure it was him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He confessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got it in writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell d'you know that? Were  you with him at the time?! You have  a good goddamn alibi for him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she was blowing him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better him than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez grabs her arm and pushes her against the wall.  Divinci looks around quickly to see who's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez angrily throws up his hands and glares at Divin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, I got nothin' at stake here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci gives him a look, then leans right up next to Cyn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what they call an open and  shut case. He did the kill and he's  going down. Don't make the mistake  of thinking you know the right thing  to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci holds out the paper. Cynthia hesitates a beat, th takes it and signs her name.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: holding a number. The SCENE FADES WHITE with the FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: CELL DOOR
dialogues.text: closing on Joe who is standing in the small CELL, facing wall, his back to us. The door is locked and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the .44 is placed on a shelf. But this time it's tagge with a different number. M5114000.

dialogues.speaker: THE SIGNED CONFESSION
dialogues.text: as Agent Simms reads through it to the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms looks across at Rodriguez and Divinci. Capt. Hender and TWO OTHER DEA AGENTS (HOOPER and SARKASIAN) are also  present. The DEA are in suits and ties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't give us his last name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signed a confession but he wouldn't  give you his last name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he couldn't remember it. (points to his head) He's a head case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You run prints?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No priors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ballistics match?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're waiting. But a forty-four was  used in commission. He had a forty- four on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It went down pretty quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they did a helluva job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Simms slams his hand down on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to Simms. He's angry. Rodriguez is uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some goddamn piece a shit blows him  away for NOTHING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intensity of Simms anger quiets everybody. A beat as  Simms regains his composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Hudd was too good for  this to happen... I just didn't think  he'd go down this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms crosses the room to Divinci and Rodriguez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes their hands. Then exits. Hooper and Sarkasian f their boss out the door. Rodriguez, Divinci and Henderson exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me a favor. Make sure this one  sticks. I don't want the D.E.Assholes  back in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEADLIGHTS (B&W) coming right at us. Closer and closer. Filling the screen

dialogues.speaker: FLAMES BURST, (COLOR)
dialogues.text: from the barrel of a .44 in SLOW MOTION -- a FIREBALL. Th GUNSHOT is deafening, like thunder.

dialogues.speaker: GLASS
dialogues.text: SHATTERS in SLOW MOTION.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: covers his face with his hands to protect himself from th glass. But there is no glass. Joe is sweating, detoxing.  Wild eyed. He looks through his fingers, but there is no  street, no dead man. Just the BARS of his CELL.

dialogues.speaker: GLASS OF WHISKEY
dialogues.text: golden liquid caressing the ice. A hand lifts the glass t red lips. The liquid disappears. Cynthia lowers the glass staring at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia... pretty name. What do the  first three letters spell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia suddenly hurls the glass across the room.

dialogues.speaker: THE GLASS
dialogues.text: shatters against the wall. And bits of glass, edges sharp tumble through space like ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD leads a MAN in a dark suit and striped tie down t corridor. He carries a briefcase. Short hair and a beard wire-rimmed glasses. His name is ELLIOT GOFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word is he killed a DEA undercover... (no response) Word is he shot him in the face... (no response) Word is he signed a confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word is everyone's entitled to a  defense... no matter how guilty they  are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop at the cell block door. The guard unlocks the d INSIDE THE CELL we can see Joe on the floor in fetal posi Shaking from lack of alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot waits in the hall. Fingers impatiently drumming hi briefcase. The door opens and a DOCTOR exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's detoxing. I gave him something  to help him through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor nods, opens the door. Elliot enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basic first aid station. Joe is on a table. Eyes closed.  Elliot walks up. Doctor behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Elliot Goff. I'm your attorney...  Do you understand what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's eyes close. Leaving Elliot in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Court is in session. Old metropolitan courthouse. The  PROSECUTOR and his TEAM are at one table. The DEFENSE ATT and his CLIENT are at the other. The Prosecutor is a woman. Her name is HELEN EDEN. She is thirty-nine. She wears a business suit. RICHARD STEIN is second in command. Richard is thirty-three. The DEFENSE ATTORNEY is fifty and a little on the portly  side. His name is JOHN OBLINGER. But it's the DEFENDANT that really attracts our attention His name is CLYDE D. DUNNER. He's done his best to look l a law abiding citizen, but no matter what kind of clothes wears or how he slicks down his long hair or trims his  mustache, this sonuvabitch looks like he'd kill for a nic He's on trial for murder. In the first. What a surprise. We are in the midst of opening statements. And Helen is  keeping the JURY riveted. The presiding Judge is a WOMAN, JUDGE WEINBERG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- when the defendant, Clyde Dunner,  entered the house of George and Carol  Beaman on Friday night, a .44 caliber  pistol in his hand. He entered the  house with one thing in mind. To  kill George and Carol, the people he  blamed for the break up of his  marriage to Carol's sister, Paula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defendant is hardly listening. His attention is on TW MEN SITTING BEHIND the prosecution table. And he turns to glare at them. The two men are DETECTIVES RODRIGUEZ and  DIVINCI. Clyde glares at them as if he'd like to get up right now, walk over to them and cut off their heads. Actually, that what he's thinking. He mouths "You die." Divinci mouths back. "Fuck you, prick, asshole, dickhead. Then he smiles. Clyde boils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Carol were watching a  movie when he entered the living  room and opened fire. George was  killed instantly, hit in the face.  Carol died later of three bullet  wounds to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Oblinger, his attorney, catches Clyde's murderous lo and instructs him, with a point of his hand, to pay atten to Helen. Clyde reluctantly turns his gaze from Divinci.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the defendant, in his effort to  cover up the crime, doused them with  lighter fluid and set the house on  fire... Carol was still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG MAN, looking very upset, enters the courtroom, sh i.d. to a GUARD, then makes his way down the aisle. He tr his best to be quiet, not to interrupt Helen's statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury we  will prove to you, beyond any  reasonable doubt, that the defendant,  Clyde David Dunner, is guilty of two  counts of murder in the first degree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen looks at the jury for a beat, then returns to her t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defense may now proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Oblinger stands to present his side of the case. But our attention stays with Helen as she approaches the tabl to find her team in an upset. Their conversation is a ten whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't know where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They looked all over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't find the murder weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunner's .44. They can't find the  goddamn gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lost it or something. Misplaced  it, I don't know. They can't find it  anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no whisper this time) What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause in the court. The judge taps his gavel in anger a we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez, Divinci, Richard Stein, the young man and Hele Helen is furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't have a goddamn case without  the goddamn gun. His fingerprints,  the ballistics, everything! I have  to have the fucking gun or he's gonna  walk. That murdering piece of filth  will go free without the .44. How  could they lose it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez and Divinci exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUEZ AND DIVINCI
dialogues.text: walking quickly down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dunner gun, you used the fucking  Dunner gun?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not my fuck up! Our shooting  was supposed to be gang-related and  unsolved! Only because we tagged a  goddamn undercover cop do we need  the fucking .44 for evidence!  Otherwise, we never woulda needed  it. So don't point your finger at  me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright... But how are we  supposed to explain how the same gun  was used in two murder cases by two  different killers when it was supposed  to be in police custody?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't explain it. It's not our  fault they lost the evidence.  Ballistics are already complete in  Dunner's case. All we need is another  gun.

dialogues.speaker: BRIEFCASE
dialogues.text: as it opens, revealing a DOZEN different HANDGUNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my merchandise is in top  condition. Untraceable. The best  money can buy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK MAN in a three piece suit, picks up the .44 with GLOVED HAND. His accent is British.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got good knock down, but it's  slow. Unless you have a preference  for revolvers, I suggest a nine  millimeter auto. They are more  expensive, but what they cost in  money, they save in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez and Divinci look down at the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The .44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun seller eyes them for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci and Rodriguez stare at the gun seller. Then he sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the NEW .44 goes onto the shelf. CASE NUMBER C-549087.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot is waiting, sitting at a table, staring at papers his open briefcase. Door opens and a GUARD leads Joe into the room. Joe looks better, for the first time. His hair combed. And he's clean. He wears jail blues. But he is a  little gaunt. And tired. Elliot stands. The guard shuts t door, leaving them alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
