dialogues.text: Joe, I'm Elliot, we met the other...  well, you weren't in very good shape.  You look much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe just stares at Elliot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a chair. We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe crosses to the table and takes a chair opposite Ellio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, before we get into what happened  that night, I'd like to check a couple  of things first. (looks at papers) Joe is your first name, I assume  Joseph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Not the answer Elliot was looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Doe? Is that what you  told the officers your last name  was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you tell them your last  name was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, is Doe your last name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot stares at Joe. This is going to be a little more  difficult than he thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what your last name is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, I'm your attorney, I'm here to  help you. It doesn't matter if you  give the court your last name or  not, they will still put you on trial.  Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's no reason to try and hide  your identity. (Joe nods) What is your last name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would tell you if I could remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Smith, Joe Jones, Joe DiMaggio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot hopes he can trigger a response. Joe tries hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Look, we'll move on. You  understand the charges against you.  They're serious. And if you are found  guilty, you could go to prison for a  very long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to prison. I killed him. I didn't  mean to. But he was going to hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know, I read your confession.  Joe, if you really felt your life  was in danger, we might be able to  use self-defense as our argument.  But before we get into that... Do  you have any family, Joe? Any friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe... do you know what a psychiatrist  is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen a psychiatrist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, you don't remember much about  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but you remember the night you  shot the man in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because... I can... I'm sorry,  I'm not much help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot stares at Joe, then looks down at the blank page i front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trial of Clyde D. Dunner in progress. Prosecution tea at their table. Defense team at their table. JUDGE WEINBE at the bench. Divinci on the stand. Clyde glaring at him. And Jury listening to Helen on the floor, prosecuting wit vigor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and when you approached the suspect  in his apartment, did you identify  yourself as a police officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the suspect respond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In what way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He started shooting through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Defendant fired six times, until  his gun was empty. We would like to  show you the weapon he used.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen crosses to the prosecution table, picks up the .44. She holds it up for the jury to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we would like to enter it into  court records. It was the same Smith  and Wesson revolver he used to  viciously murder George and Carol  Beaman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The .44 is duly entered into the records.

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: glances at "his" .44 as it passes into the BAILIFF'S HAND It's a .44 all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prosecution would like to call  Mr. Steven J. Allen to the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven J. Allen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVEN J. ALLEN, a short balding bespectacled man in his  fifties, crosses to the witness box where he is sworn in, then sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Allen, would tell the court what  you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a lab technician for the police  department. One of my duties is to  examine weapons used in violent  crimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde's attention is on Helen's LEGS. He's bored by the  proceedings, but something suddenly strikes him. He looks

dialogues.speaker: THE .44 SMITH AND WESSON
dialogues.text: -- on the evidence table. There is no BLACK STAIN on the  handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tested the defendant's revolver  and matched the bullets fired to the  bullets removed from the deceased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't my gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All attention turns to Clyde. His attorney, the judge, th jury, Helen, everybody is surprised by the sudden stateme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must remind the defendant that he  is not to speak out when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't my gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge taps her gavel. John Oblinger puts a hand on Cl arm. Clyde pulls it away. And now things happen very fast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THAT AIN'T MY FUCKIN' GUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Clyde is moving toward the gun. And the Bailiff and G are moving toward Clyde. And Helen is moving out of the w And the Judge is standing, banging her gavel. And the jur is scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU'RE TRYIN' TO FUCKIN' FRAME ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde grabs for the gun as the bailiff and guards grab fo Clyde. Clyde turns and decks the bailiff and all hell bre lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT AIN'T MY FUCKIN' GUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door slams open. Rodriguez and Divinci enter. Rodriguez  quickly checks all the stalls as Divinci closes the door. They are alone. When Rodriguez finishes with the stalls -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta put the right gun back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't put the right gun back!  Without that gun, they won't convict  Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without that gun they won't convict  Clyde!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not worried about Clyde, I'm  worried about us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Joe's never goin' to trial,  right. He signed a goddamn confession!  Like you said, this one is open and  shut. Clyde's the one we gotta worry  about. We can't let him go back on  the street! He's a fuckin' psychopath.  He'll kill somebody again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. How the hell did that piece of  puke know it wasn't his fuckin' gun?!  I don't think he knows his own fuckin'  mother, but he knows his fuckin'  gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's important right  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The harried Desk Officer is filling out his usual paper w when Divinci and Rodriguez approach. Divinci knocks on th door. The desk officer looks up. He's had a tough day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Divinci, can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you mean you can't do it? I  gotta check something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta get written permission  from the Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since an hour ago when he came down  here and chewed me a new asshole  bigger than a three car garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about missing evidence or  who the hell knows. I just wanna  transfer the hell outa here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell're we supposed to do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask the chief. Policy ain't my  department!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's preliminary trial. Joe is seated at the defense tab with Elliot. ANOTHER JUDGE, JUDGE HAROLD PINE, is behind bench. No jury. This is a preliminary hearing to determin if there's enough evidence for Joe to stand trail. Elliot shuffling papers in preparation for his opening. And at the prosecution table is a very tired Helen. She l completely pissed off and worn out. In no mood for anythi to go wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would like to plead not guilty to  the charge of murder at this time  for reason of Insanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen gives Elliot a look. She doesn't need this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot turns to Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Joe. Let me handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I signed the confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Joe. Don't worry about it. I'm  the attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, can we have a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Council may approach the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen and Elliot cross to the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, my colleague's client  admits to the killing. I don't see  any reason to go through a trial  when it's obvious he would like to  plead guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he wants to plead guilty, you  have to let him plead guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if he's not of sound mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Elliot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's crazy. I know you think  he's just putting it on, that's D.A.  standard procedure, but I don't think  he is. So, your honor, I'm standing  by the not guilty because I believe  he's incapable of making that  judgment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you had a psychiatrist look at  him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your honor. (hands him papers) I think you'll see that my diagnosis  is not without warrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The judge hesitates, then looks at Joe. Joe is staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll review the findings and make my  decision tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, your honor. (to Helen) Besides, I hear there's a good chance  of beating the charges for lack of  evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen's look turns icy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, smoky. Not a place for the health-conscious. Rodrig and Divinci at a corner booth. Both with scotch and water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody can connect us to the evidence  thing... we're clean there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most important one is this DEA  mess anyway. Once that's finished,  we're completely in the clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know we can't do it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yeah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're through. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good while it lasted though. A hundred  grand apiece. Not bad for a few nights  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci lifts his glass in a toast to himself, drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna get through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna get through it. No  evidence problems on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope not... I don't know, Frank,  lately I been thinkin'... maybe what  we did wasn't such a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we took out a few scumbags,  that's it. Nobody's ever gonna miss  those shitheels. They were all pieces  of garbage. Not one of 'em had a  sheet less than a mile long. Drugs,  extortion, assault. They were all  fuckin' guilty as hell and still on  the street, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except the cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, except the cop. That's part of  the job. Could just as easily have  happened to you or me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're cops, you know? We fucked  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fucked up once. Once outa ten.  That's not bad. (a beat) I'm sorry, okay? I'm sorry. He was  in the wrong place at the wrong time,  what can I say. I'm not goin' down  for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if we got paid a decent salary  we wouldn't be tempted by this, right?  And what happens when we retire? You  think our pension's gonna take care  of us? Shit no. We are on our own. I  mean all I want in life is a goddamn  fishing boat, a beach, a couple drinks  and some Hawaiian fuckin' music.  That ain't much for twenty years  putting murdering assholes behind  bars. I mean, the dealers, the pimps,  the killers, they got no rules. We  got all the fuckin' rules. It ain't  fair. That's all I'm sayin', it ain't  fair... For awhile, we made it fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez downs his scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit thinkin' you're a bad guy. You're  not a fuckin' bad guy. You made one  mistake. Let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez nods. A WAITRESS comes to the table. Rodriguez  orders another. The Waitress leaves. Rodriguez hesitates moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think we're corrupt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I never took a fuckin' bribe in  my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody ever bought me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fuckin' way. Even the thought  makes me sick. And what we did has  nothing to do with being corrupt.  It's two completely different things.  Don't get 'em confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you. It's nothin' to do  with corrupt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you gotta worry a little. It's  natural. Just don't lose your sense  of humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sense of humor, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem with people is, nobody  gives a shit about makin' the world  a better place. You and me, I don't  care what anybody says, we made the  world a better place. No matter what  happens. There are ten less drug  dealin' assholes on the street today  because of us. They're not plea  bargainin' their way back onto the  street, they're not clogging up the  courts, and they're not costing the  tax payers a fuckin' penny because  they're not in prison. They were  garbage. And there's nothin' wrong  with takin' out the garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci downs his scotch. Rodriguez nods, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you think you'll get back with  Caroline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Nothin' I ever do is good  enough, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never is, never was, never will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I gotta make the effort. It's  gonna cost me if I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. You know how much  I got left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna think I'm an idiot,  but... I like Cynthia. There's no  bullshit with her. I just fuckin'  like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you just like fuckin' her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez smiles. Divinci looks at him for a beat, then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that, too.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSPAPER
dialogues.text: with JOE'S PHOTOGRAPH on the front page. HEADLINE: UNDERC COP GUNNED DOWN BY UNDERCOVER KILLER. We PAN AROUND to  Cynthia, sitting in her kitchen, staring at the photograp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell, Joe, at least you  won't get run over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She folds up the paper and throws it in the trash can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dunner trial. The JURY is back. Helen, Judge Weinberg Clyde D. Dunner (who now sports a couple bandages to his  head), his attorney John Oblinger -- they're all waiting the verdict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defendant will stand and face  the jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your verdict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find the defendant, Clyde David  Dunner, not guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen closes her eyes in defeat. Clyde smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- when was the last time you saw  him? -- Uh-huh -- And you haven't  seen him since then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez suddenly strides up. He looks panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Just a second. (covers phone) Calm down. I heard. Clyde walked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (leans in close) They're takin' Joe to trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci stares at Rodriguez for a beat, the reality of hi statement taking a moment to fully slam home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found him mentally unable to  plead so his attorney pleaded not  guilty by reason of insanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kiddin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's me, I love to make people  laugh. You hear the one about the  two cops who popped the undercover  DEA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia on stage, in the middle of her routine. Hoots and whistles from the all MALE CROWD. But she's not really in her performance tonight. She pulls off the last of her  clothing to APPLAUSE and CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia enters. An ASIAN MAN in sweat shirt and jeans is  sitting in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell're you and what the  fuck are you doing in here?! (calls down hall) HEY, BOB, I GOT AN ASSHOLE IN THE  DRESSING ROOM. (to the man) I suggest you get out before Bob  gets here. He doesn't like assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Cynthia Webb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls down hall) BOB!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Asian Man stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you are Cynthia Webb the famous  dancer, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, nice try, get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man moves toward her, pulling a PAPER from his pocket He hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked your show very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits. No answer. Cynthia stares at the paper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A subpoena?! For what?! I didn't do  anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the man is gone. BOB, a HUGE BOUNCER, tears past, giv chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at paper) Oh shit... oh shit. He served me! He  fuckin' served me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, quiet. PHONE RINGS. A hand picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Divinci?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Sergeant Gardner down at the  station.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: The station is alive with activity. Even at this early ho HOOKERS, PIMPS, PUSHERS, DRUNK DRIVERS. Some being booked some being released, some being obnoxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to call so late, but I got a  hysterical woman here says she needs  to talk to you about a murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci turns on the light revealing a WOMAN in bed with  him. He picks up his watch, looks at the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her I couldn't call you at  home, but she said that it was very  important. A matter of, you know,  life and death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci perks up at the name. And now we SEE Cynthia in the POLICE STATION trying not t look as freaked out as she feels. But she's not holding  together well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to wait, I'll be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci hangs up. Starts to dress. The woman groans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go down to the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, this is no way to repair our  marriage, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls the covers over her head. Divinci pulls on his  pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci pushes into the room. Sees Cynthia sitting on the bench, looking nervous as hell. Smoking, tapping her foot looking around. Just this side of a wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia sees him and is immediately on her feet, moving t him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, I can't do this. He came to  the club. You gotta --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her arm, leads her out of the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci leads Cynthia out of the station to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said all I had to do  was pick him out?! That's what you  said, that's all I had to do. I did  what you said. But that was supposed  to be all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUT UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the driver's door, pushes her in. Gets in behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is a bundle of nerves. Divinci slams the door. Cy is startled by the suddenness of his anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia opens her purse and pulls out the subpoena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci glances at the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised me I wasn't gonna have  to do anything! What the hell is  goin' on?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is yet another glitch that Divinci hadn't counted on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this, Frank. I can't go  into court. I'm gettin' outa here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not getting outa here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I can't go to court! THAT'S NOT  WHAT YOU SAID I'D HAVE TO DO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WELL THIS WASN'T SUPPOSED TO HAPPEN!  NOW JUST FUCKIN' CALM DOWN FOR A  SECOND AND LET ME THINK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia glares at him, then turns away, takes a drag and  blows out the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Think away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci hesitates as ANOTHER CAR pulls out. Then turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you're a witness, that's all.  You got nothin' to worry about. You  saw something happen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What?! What did I see?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will tell you everything you gotta  know. You understand? Everything.  You will know exactly what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia looks at Divinci, unsure. Divinci gives her a  confident smile. Look, it's another stage, that's all. Ju like dancin'.

dialogues.speaker: THE UNMARKED CAR
dialogues.text: pulls quickly out of the PARKING GARAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot is waiting. The guard opens the door and Joe enter Joe is looking better. Getting him off booze has helped  immensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Joe. You're looking much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess jail's been good for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot nods, motions for Joe to take a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trial date's been set for Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about what I did...  and I don't think it's right that I  try getting off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to plead guilty. I killed a  man and I should be punished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm a little surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody ever wants to be punished for  what they've done. It's just a new  concept. But I still think our defense  is reasonable. I don't believe, under  the condition you were in, that you  were responsible for your actions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why was I carrying a gun? I had  no right to carry a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hadn't been carrying the gun,  you might be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he might be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand... Can I think about  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I've made up my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot stares at Joe for a beat, then we --

dialogues.speaker: YELLOW CRIME SCENE TAPE
dialogues.text: TWO MURDER VICTIMS lying in the street. POLICE OFFICERS h the area under control. A few CURIOUS PEOPLE have stopped watch. An UNMARKED CAR pulls up. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked. Rodriguez behind the wheel. Divinci next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if she takes off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we got no goddamn witness puts  him at the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what happens if she testifies  and nobody fuckin' believes her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perjury, maybe. But that's a fifty  fifty. They might believe her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Frank, she's a goddamn stripper  for Chrissake, who's gonna believe  her. I don't believe her when she's  telling the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OFFICER walks to the car and knocks on the window. Div rolls it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, we got two bodies out here and  three more in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just wondering if you were  gonna be the primary on this one,  that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, we're comin'. Just give  us some room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci rolls the window back up. The officer backs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could blow the whole thing. She  could tie us in and that would be  it. We'd be fuckin' fried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it looks like she's gonna crumble  we'll take steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What steps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci looks at Rodriguez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more chalk outline more or less  in this city who's gonna know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, you think I like this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just can't go around killin'  everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second. Look around. Whatta  we got here? Two stiffs on the street,  shot to shit, three more inside.  That's five chalk lines in one night  in one deal in one neighborhood in  one city. Let me fill you in on some  statistics, we're not killin'  everybody. (a beat, then --) Look, this is strictly last resort.  Okay? But let's not kid ourselves.  If push comes to shove, somebody has  to go down. If you got another  candidate, I'm willin' to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez is silent. Divinci opens the door. Rodriguez wa him, then he follows. To the scene of another crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is in the kitchen, making herself a peanut butter and jelly sandwich as she watches Sally Jesse Raphael  interview yet another moron on television. The phone ring She takes a bite of the sandwich as she picks up and mumb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: INT. OFFICE
dialogues.text: Richard Stein, the attorney, is on the phone. His office cluttered with the myriad of case files he's forced to ju

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia Webb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallows) ...yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Richard Stein with the District  Attorney's office. You're a witness  in a case we're handling and I'd  like to talk to you as soon as  possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia puts down the sandwich, her appetite suddenly gon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms Webb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance we could get together  today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) I'm ah... pretty busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't take long. Will you be home  about two? (no answer) Ms Webb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay... two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Let me make sure I've got your  correct address.

dialogues.speaker: SUITCASE
dialogues.text: as clothes are stuffed into it. The suitcase is slammed s And Cynthia heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK CONVERTIBLE MERCEDES pulls into the circular, gat drive of the large two story home on immense manicured  grounds. A BMW is parked in front of the FOUR CAR GARAGE. is being waxed by car care specialists. The Mercedes stop and a MAN gets out. He has gray hair and expensive clothe He carries a briefcase and heads for the front door. His  name is ARTHUR BAYLOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUTLER shows Arthur to the patio where another MAN, NAT MCCALL, is seated behind a table, reviewing documents. Mc is fifty-five, wears glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Baylor is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCall looks up, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur crosses. The two men shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, Arthur, thanks. Would you like  some coffee, juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is all a bit of a mystery.  You certainly got my attention with  your phone call. What's this all  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur removes a NEWSPAPER from his briefcase. Opens it.  Revealing the PHOTOGRAPH OF JOE and the headline: UNDERCO COP GUNNED DOWN BY UNDERCOVER KILLER. McCall looks at the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something you want me to  see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur points at the photograph. McCall looks. A beat, th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia boards a greyhound. Getting the hell out of Dodge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR a key in the lock. The door opens and Divinci ent He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves into the bedroom. Sees clothes strewn around and half empty closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads back into the living room. Pulls open the door a almost runs into Richard Stein who was just about to knoc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Stein is just as startled and it takes him a mome to recognize --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci is caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Stein, D.A.'s office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, sorry. I didn't expect --  what're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk with Cynthia Webb. A  witness in -- well, wait, aren't you  and Detective Rodriguez on this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vamping) Yeah, yeah, that's why I'm here. I  wanted to go over some of the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. Is she there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was supposed to meet her at two. (looks at watch) Do you know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just mean, if she's not  here... you were... (a little awkward) ...inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forces a smile) Oh, yeah, the legal thing. Well,  she's a witness in a murder case.  And when they don't answer a knock  and the door's open, it's my  experience, you know. I like to make  sure there's no dead bodies layin'  around. (pulls door shut) Don't tell on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, of course not... Well, maybe  I should wait. She might be stuck in  traffic or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. If she shows up, let me know.  I'd like to talk to her, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci looks at Stein for a beat, then smiles and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you in court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci heads down the walkway. Richard Stein watches him for a moment, then looks at the closed door, then at his  watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot's office is a cramped space in the PUBLIC DEFENDER FLOOR of the CRIMINAL COURTS BUILDING. A buzz of activity outside. The staff is overworked, underpaid and  underappreciated. Elliot is reviewing legal documents. Kn on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Arthur Baylor enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot Goff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot looks up and suddenly recognizes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur Baylor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot is stunned and flattered. He stands quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur Baylor, oh my God. I ahh,  would you ahh... are you here to see  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door opens. Joe is lead into the room by the JAIL GUARD. looks even better now. His stay in jail has broken his  dependency on alcohol. His hair is clean and combed. And  he's not as depressed. He stops upon seeing Elliot and Ar at the table. Both men stand. The guard shuts the door. A looks at Joe for a moment, then says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe stares at Arthur as if fighting a lost memory, then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you telling me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Stein is facing a not very happy Helen. She is se behind her desk stacked high with case files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She missed the appointment? She forget  you were coming? What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want my best guess, I'd say  she split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She split, our witness split... Can't  we keep our evidence and witnesses  from disappearing around here? I  mean what do I have to do, lock them  in the trunk of my car? What the  fuck is going on?! I want that bitch  back here and on the stand or in  jail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Stein nods quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he exits fast. He doesn't like it when his boss is pi And right now his boss is really pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seedy side street near the courthouse and jail. The unm car pulls up and Divinci gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior is sparse. Several FRAMED FIGHT POSTERS on t walls. All with MANNY LADREW, a young tough fighter in th featherweight division, in his best pose, explaining wher and when the next bout will be -- but all these posters a at least fifteen years old. Two desks. One for the secretary, who is on vacation, and the other for MANNY LADREW, the ex-pugilist. He's put on  some pounds in the intervening years, plus an added thin  mustache. Manny is on the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- yeah, uh-huh. (takes notes) Why you think he'd go there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covers phone) Just a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just a second, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny glares at Divinci. He doesn't like Divinci, never h never will. But he's a cop. Cop's you have to make room f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I'll call you back. (hangs up) What d'you want, Divinci?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci pulls some papers out of his pocket, hands them t Manny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a witness who took off. I gotta  get her back. I don't got a lotta  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the fuckin' police. What're  you comin' to me for?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask fuckin' questions, you  just find her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny, annoyed, looks at the papers -- photo of Cynthia  included.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where've I seen her before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right, okay. So what'd she  take off for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I know what you fuckin' said, but  you want me to find her I gotta know  why the fuck she took off! So I know  where not to look! Okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she's supposed to testify. She  got scared, thinks somebody might  kill her, so she's hidin'. That's  why I want you to find her. If  somebody is tryin' to pop her, I  don't want anyone knowin' where she  is. Manny eyes Divinci. He doesn't  believe anything anybody tells him.  Especially in his business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long I got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, two fuckin' days!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find her, puss head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci glares at Manny, then exits. Manny watches him le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Detective. Always like to help  out the police whenever possible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe (William) is lead into the courtroom by GUARDS. Takes his place at the DEFENSE TABLE which includes Elliot and YOUNG ATTORNEYS. The PROSECUTION TABLE, which includes Ri Stein and Helen is going over last minute minutia. PEOPLE are taking seats in the gallery. But another attor joins the Defense table. It's Arthur Baylor. And Richard  Stein double-takes when he sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Helen) Isn't that Arthur Baylor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch Arthur shake hands with everyone - Elliot, the two young attorneys and Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur takes a seat at the defense table and glances acro at Helen and Richard and nods. Helen and Richard are stun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear ye, hear ye. All rise, face our  flag and recognize the principles  for which it stands. The Criminal  Court, Department G is now in session.  The Honorable Harold W. Pine  presiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone rises as JUDGE HAROLD PINE enters. In black robe Taking his place behind the bench. He sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please be seated and come to order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sits. And even Judge Harold Pine double-takes wh he sees Arthur Baylor at the Defense table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The People versus Joe Doe in case  number 95-24705.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we proceed, I'd like to ask  the Defense if there's anything this  court should be made aware of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your honor. I have joined the  defense in the representation of Mr.  William Dane McCall, otherwise known  to this court as Joe Doe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to look at Joe (William McCall). CAMERA PU in on him. It doesn't look as if he's sure who he is yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have represented the McCall family  for several years before William  McCall's disappearance seven years  ago. It was assumed that he had died,  but since he has reappeared under  these tragic circumstances, I would  ask this court for a continuance to  allow the defense to prepare  adequately in light of his real  identity now being known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One week should be sufficient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any objection to a week's continuance  by the State?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... believe so, your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I grant a one week continuance.  We will start the proceedings next  Monday morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Harold Pine taps his gavel.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION NEWS REPORTS
dialogues.text: FLASH Joe's photograph and scenes of him being lead from courtroom. Helen and Richard Stein are watching. They can believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- when it was discovered that the  man who has confessed to killing an  undercover DEA agent, was actually  himself thought dead for seven years.  The man who signed the confession as  Joe Doe is actually William Dane  McCall, brother of Nathan McCall.  Both are sons of the founder of McCall  International, a corporation involved  in telecommunications, computer design  and development and other related  industries. The net worth of both  men is estimated at over a billion  dollars --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked on the street. Rodriguez and Divinci inside. Rodri reads the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- but William McCall shunned the  business world and turned his life  to medicine, receiving his medical  degree from Harvard in 1969. Once  again he turned his back on the  established norm and spent several  years in Africa performing organ  transplants for the poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez slams down the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, this is who you picked?  A goddamn surgeon who performs organ  transplants on poor Africans?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was living in the fuckin' street!  How the hell was I supposed to know  he was a goddamn doctor?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a goddamn doctor! You picked  a fuckin' Saint to pin a fuckin'  murder on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci grabs the paper away from him. Both cops are angr upset, frustrated and scared to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we pick 'em, we really fuckin'  pick 'em. We shoulda just picked up  the fuckin' Pope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) -- he disappeared seven years ago on  September 19 two weeks after the  tragic death of his wife and two  young children in a multiple vehicle  accident. At the time it was assumed  that he had returned to Africa, but  that was never confirmed. What William  McCall has been doing for seven years  is now the mystery that the court  will try to help unravel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci closes the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, let's think here.  What's the worse case scenario?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking me if I can think of  something worse than what we've done  that we can still do, or something  worse that might happen to us if  this all blows up and we are convicted  and sent to jail and die in the  electric chair and go to hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci looks at Rodriguez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work with me here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm a little on edge.  Would you repeat the question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men are quiet for a moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if the doc walks, there's no  evidence ties us to it. There's only  one person who can connect us to  Hudd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine, I don't wanna argue about  it anymore. Let's just fuckin' kill  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny LaDrew is pouring himself a cup of coffee. His SECR is typing up a letter at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny recognizes the voice. He mouths an oh fuck to himse then turns around to Divinci who is standing in the doorw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fuckin' with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not fuckin' with you. Are  you fuckin' with me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this is a good one. You're a  cop and you don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops got her. Ain't that a gas. Cops  got her, you're a cop, and you gotta  find out from me. It's a crazy world  we live in, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci suddenly explodes, going for Manny, grabbing him, slamming him against the wall, his arm to Manny's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops?! What fuckin' cops?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what fuckin' cops. All  I know is, my people got to her  sister's place and she was already  gone. Her sister said some cops took  her. I thought it was you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci glares at Manny for a beat, then he storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny looks down at his Secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good judge of character.

dialogues.speaker: DIVINCI
dialogues.text: at his desk, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- look, she's our witness, if she's  in custody, somebody better tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci slams down the phone. He sits quietly for a momen then rubs his face. Rodriguez crosses to his desk, sits d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'. Nobody knows nothin'. The  D.A. thinks she's gone. D.E.A. doesn't  know shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she was bein' held by police,  we'd know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless she said somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she said something we wouldn't be  sittin' here. (a beat, then --) I think it's that lyin' piece of  shit.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: getting the shit beat out of him. The room is dark. Two m are hammering on Manny. Throwing him against the wall, pu him up and hitting him in the stomach -- not the face.  Throwing him across the room, over the desk. Manny is too hurt to get up. Divinci walks over to him, rubbing his gl hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever lie to me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny looks up weakly. Divinci walks away. Rodriguez open the door and they exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is sitting on his cot, staring at the floor. ANOTHER is in the cell with him, reading a magazine. His name is  DUNCAN. Duncan looks at Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First trial, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got one piece of advise. When you  break for lunch, don't get the  pastrami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the BARRED CELL DOOR open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe gets up. Puts out his hands. They shackle him as we H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear ye, hear ye. All rise, face our  flag and recognize the principles  for which it stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is lead down the hall by TWO GUARDS, past rows of cel filled with other PRISONERS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Criminal Court, Department G is  now in session. The Honorable Harold  W. Pine presiding. (We HEAR people rise) Please be seated and come to order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is lead to a waiting prison van. He gets inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The People versus William McCall in  case number 95-24705.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: THE .44 SMITH AND WESSON, (CLYDE'S .44)
dialogues.text: as it is introduced into evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- when he pulled this gun and fired  at the driver of the car. Killing  him instantly. Let the record show  that this is the weapon used in the  crime, a Smith and Wesson forty-four  caliber handgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe is sitting at the Defense table with Arthur and Ellio The trial is underway. And they watch the .44 go to the  evidence table -- the .44 with the BLACK STAIN. Richard Stein is seated at the Defense table. He, too, is watching the .44. He leans across to his ASSISTANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these goddamn guns are startin'  to look the same to me.

dialogues.speaker: DIVINCI
dialogues.text: on the stand, being questioned by Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you arrested the defendant,  did he deny that he had killed Agent  Hudd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you describe the defendant's  condition at the time of his arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was drunk. We could smell the  booze on him. But we drew blood. He  didn't object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have the blood test report that  shows -- (picks up report) -- that he had four times the legal  limit to drive. The people would  like to enter this into evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They so enter it.

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGUEZ
dialogues.text: on the stand. Elliot is cross-examining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and you arrested the defendant  four days after the killing. What  lead you to suspect Mr. McCall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask questions. Work the  neighborhood. Find out who was on  the street that night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but specifically Mr. McCall? He  had no previous criminal record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found someone who'd seen him in  the area. So we picked him up for  questioning. We didn't expect it to  be him. But if someone saw him in  the area that night we would want to  talk to him. If he wasn't the killer,  he might've seen the killer. Just  routine really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you find the defendant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the street. Corner of Third and  Madison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was passed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you knew it was the man you were  looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Based on what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His description.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who provided you with the description?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates a beat) Cynthia something, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot moves to the defense table, glances at Arthur as h picks up a paper. Arthur nods approvingly. Elliot looks a the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe her name is Cynthia Webb.  According to the statement filed the  night she picked him out of the line- up. The name familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... that's her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you find Ms Webb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the street. Same area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she agreed to pick the defendant  out of a line up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you aware that Ms Webb  disappeared after she was served  with a subpoena?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my partner and I tried to contact  her about the case and were  unsuccessful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Detective, that's all the  questions I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez gets up as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waitress cruises past tables to the booth in the back. sets down two scotch and waters to the two men. Rodriguez and Divinci. The waitress exits. Divinci picks up his gla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To justice in all its forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez picks up his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not home free yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without Ms Webb, there's no place  they can go. We still got the  confession, the gun, the ballistics...  And I don't give a shit about all  this African doctor crap... the man  is a drunk and he's been a drunk for  seven goddamn years. So lets have a  drink for drunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez reluctantly lifts his glass. They clink and dri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the thing about life. You  control it or it controls you. Most  people don't understand that. They  try'n blame their fuck-ups on  something or somebody else. But it's  not like that. I don't wanna hear  why your life's a mess. It's a mess  cause you're a mess. That simple.  They're waitin' to live happily ever  after. But after what? After all the  shit happens? Well, I got a clue for  everybody, the shit never stops  happening. So you deal with it or  you get buried in it. I'm not talkin'  about you, you know what I'm sayin'  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life don't work in mysterious ways.  There ain't no mystery to it. You  just work it. And you don't take it  too serious. You can't take it too  serious otherwise you get fragile.  And you can't be fragile and have  any fuckin' fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm fragile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the first sign of trouble,  when you start askin' other people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I just wish I knew where the hell  she was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen and Richard Stein are working late. Over take-out  Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to papers) -- so I think we'll have to rely on  the confession for his description  of what happened. He'll never take  the stand, even if --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. Richard picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) D.A.'s office... What?... When?...  Where will --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is surprised. He turns to Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found Cynthia Webb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well who the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. They hung up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard hangs up the receiver. He and Helen exchange a lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, the people call Ms.  Cynthia Webb to the stand.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS REACTIONS
dialogues.text: Rodriguez and Divinci are stunned. Cynthia? Elliot is  completely surprised. Cynthia? Arthur is never shaken by  anything. The courtroom doors open and Cynthia is lead down the ais by a SHERIFF'S DEPUTY. She moves to the chair. But it's Joe's turn to double take. He remembers her. My  God, he knows her. It's Cynthia -- the girl from the apar building. He never saw who pointed him out, but he never  expected it to be her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raise your right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia raises her hand. But her look goes right to Joe.  Staring at him. She's never seen Joe like this -- cleaned up, trimmed, handsome. She's not sure she even recognizes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You swear to tell the truth, the  whole truth and nothing but the truth  so help you God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her eyes from Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may be seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia sits down. Looks at Divinci. And Joe leans across to Arthur and Elliot. Their conversa is in whispers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the woman who identified you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I mean I know her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure... I think I lived near  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur exchanges a look with Elliot. Arthur turns now and looks at Cynthia. The wheels are turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please state your name for the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia Webb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see the man that you identified  in a police line-up in this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it the defendant, Mr. McCall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia looks at Joe. Joe looks straight at her. Cynthia  turns her eyes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please describe what you saw the  night of September 14th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was comin' out of an all night  minimart --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia comes out of a ALL NIGHT MINI-MART with a bag of  food. She walks down the street and suddenly we HEAR a  GUNSHOT. Followed by a CAR CRASH. She turns toward the so And we HEAR RUNNING FOOTSTEPS. Then we see a man running. has a pistol in one hand. Cynthia watches the man run past and disappear into the  darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is looking at Helen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're positive the man you saw  with the gun is the defendant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of looking at Joe, Cynthia turns to Rodriguez and Divinci who are seated in the rows behind the prosecution table. They are looking right at her. They wait for her  answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No further questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci offers her a small smile. Cynthia turns away. Arthur is now standing in front of he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Webb... is it Miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Webb, had you ever seen the  defendant before that night, the  night you described to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what perjury is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you lie under oath in a court  of law. Do you know what the penalty  for that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Cynthia, have you ever seen  the defendant before that night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection. The witness has already  answered that question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to give the witness the  opportunity to remember if she could  have seen Mr. McCall anyplace else  before the night in question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci stares at Cynthia. As if willing her to give the  answer he wants her to give.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Webb, do you understand the  consequences of perjury?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get on with it then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you buy the night you went  into the mini-mart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I buy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remembered seeing Mr. McCall  that night and hearing the gunshot  and a car crash. I just wondered if  you remembered what you bought in  the mini-mart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...shampoo I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4356 17th Street. Number 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that close to where this mini- mart is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close? Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far would you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within walking distance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you walk there that night or  drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ahh... drove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drove. But when you left the  mini-mart you stated that you walked  down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection. Your honor, I don't see a  point to this line of questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your honor. Since this is the  only witness, I'm trying to establish  what the scene was like that night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to get there as quickly as  possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cynthia) And how far away from the corner was  the Mini-mart? For example was it in  the middle of the block, close to  the corner, where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you walked all the way to the  corner. I assume then you were walking  back to your car, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there a reason you parked so far  away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting nervous) Um... there were lots of cars parked  on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anyone else on the street  besides you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of cars, but no people. Any  traffic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you were the only person to see  Joe on the street that night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see anybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you heard a gunshot, a car crash  and a man running with a gun in his  hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do then? Did you call  the police, 911?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went home. Straight home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're sure it was Joe you saw  that night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you went home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you went home you saw Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia realizes what she's said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection. Defense is trying to  confuse the witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not trying to confuse the witness,  it's the witness that's trying to  confuse the court. I have witnesses  who will refute her testimony.  Witnesses who were on that corner  the night of the shooting, who never  saw Ms. Webb, who never heard the  gunshot, who never saw Joe run past.  Ms Webb saw Joe outside her apartment  building that night because he lived  in the alley next to it. Isn't that  right, Ms Webb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur turns dramatically to Cynthia. She is scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's attention is on Cynthia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I referred to him as Joe, you  knew who I was talking about, didn't  you. This case is the People versus  Mr. William McCall. Not Joe. Joe has  never been mentioned in this trial.  How did you know who I was talking  about, Ms. Webb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia looks from Arthur to Divinci. Divinci is frozen.  Rodriguez is sweating. Then Cynthia turns and looks at Joe. Joe looks at her, feeling sorry for her. Not hating her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Webb, how did you know that Joe  was the defendant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia lowers her eyes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lived in the alley next to my  apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen and Richard Stein are stunned yet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci and Rodriguez are doing their best to remain cool calm and collected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you lie to this court?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid of somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you protecting somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the questions, Ms. Webb or  I'll be forced to cite you for  contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia looks up at the judge. She's not talking.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA
dialogues.text: having her mug shots taken. Holding a number. On the FLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hold your breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she'll talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know she'll talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll make it look gang related.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem is we're gonna need another  gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem?! Have you forgotten?  She's in fucking jail. That's the  goddamn problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when is being in jail a guaranty  of a long life? You just get a fuckin'  gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez gets out of the car. Divinci pulls away, drivin into traffic. Rodriguez heads into the Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci enters. Manny looks up from his desk. His face is bruised and bandaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. I didn't do anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine, Manny. I just  came to apologize. (looks at secretary) We need some privacy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny looks at Divinci, then motions for his Secretary to take a walk. She gets up, exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one more favor. I want you to  bail somebody out of jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kiddin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bail's twenty-five thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci pulls out a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want her out tonight. And don't  tell her who. It's a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how'm I payin' for this? They  don't take American Express.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci pulls a plastic bag filled with cocaine out of hi pocket -- tosses it onto Manny's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you know how to exchange that.  It's worth a lot more than twenty- five grand. You can keep the change. (points to cocaine) I want her back in two hours... Or  I'll nail you for possession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get to be such a prick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia sits alone in her cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe lies on his cot. But even though he is in jail for mu he is no longer the bum. This is a new man now. Clean sha Hair cut. Prison clothes neat. Duncan rolls over on his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to say nothin', but...  you really a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I was... a surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit, no shit, really. A surgeon.  I know I'm nobody to judge, but you  musta been a smart guy. What the  hell's a smart guy like you doin' in  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe looks up at Duncan, hesitates, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I had an affair with another  woman... a nurse at the hospital I  worked at. It was nothing... I can't  even remember much about her... Except  my wife found out. We had a fight.  She left the house, took the kids...  She was hysterical. I should've done  something... gone after them, I don't  know... they were killed in a car  accident about a mile from the  house... I've never told anybody  that... about why she left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duncan nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, doc, you can trust me. It won't  go no farther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez is outside the Station. Looking nervous and ups The unmarked car pulls up. Rodriguez moves for the car. H gets in and the car pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci drives. Rodriguez sweats. Divinci notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? We're going to kill  a goddamn witness who's in fucking  jail because we killed an undercover  DEA agent. I'm sorry, but this kinda  shit troubles me a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off the dress and get back in  the game. We gotta do what we gotta  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know. Let's just get it over  with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci glances at Rodriguez. He's more nervous than norm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny walks out of the jail building. Cynthia is with him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Why can't you  tell me who put up the bond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, a guy comes in, says bail her  out, gives me the money, I do it.  That's how I make my living, I bail  fuckin' people outa jail. You wait  with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Cops bail people outa  jail all the time. Doesn't there  seem to be a dichotomy there for  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna stay in jail, that's up to  you. Or you come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a stripper right? Lotta guys  fall in love with your type. But  they don't know how to get close,  know what I mean? Somebody wants you  to owe them something. (shrugs) Take it or leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
