dialogues.text: Manny starts down the steps. Cynthia hesitates, then foll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci and Rodriguez watch Cynthia get into the car with Manny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the last time, Frank. The  last time we kill somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll be eleven, Frank. Eleven is  enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci looks at Rodriguez. He's staring out the window, he looks ill. Something is not right with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was all okay until you shot Hudd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on here? You mad at me  or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't my idea to start killing  people, Frank. That's all I'm sayin'.  We're in this goddamn mess because  you started killing people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drug dealers don't qualify as people.  Never did, never will. So what the  hell's wrong with you tonight? You  suddenly worried about where all the  money went?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just sick of it, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci stares at Rodriguez for a beat, then starts car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unmarked car turns off the street onto the side stree and stops. The lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some fresh air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci exits. Rodriguez hesitates, then gets out with hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me, okay? Just fuckin' talk  to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez hesitates a moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I owe some money. I  don't know how I'm gonna pay it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gambling again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah... I just couldn't...  Frank... let's forget about this.  Let's just get the fuck outa here.  We got enough money, let's go. We'll  get outa the country or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci turns toward Rodriguez. And he's got his pistol o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell're you doin'?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take off your shirt. If there's  nothin' to worry about, then I'll  apologize. But I'm not gonna argue.  Take off your fuckin' shirt now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, you piece of shit?!  You don't trust me?! Is that it?!  YOU DON'T FUCKIN' TRUST ME AFTER ALL  WE'VE BEEN THROUGH?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Take off your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, you don't trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm askin' you one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna shoot me? Shoot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci hesitates. He doesn't want to. This is his partne A beat, then he lowers his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm sorry. You're right. I'm  fuckin' nervous. Like you. Forget  it. This thing... shit. Let's just  get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci holsters his gun. Rodriguez hesitates, breathes a sigh, then returns to the car. They both get back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci starts up the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just feel a whole lot better  when she's dead. Then we're off the  hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci starts to shift gears, but suddenly throws his el into Rodriguez' face. And Divinci is all over him like a  tornado. Slamming a fist into his face repeatedly. He gra his shirt and rips it open REVEALING the TAPE RECORDER  strapped to his body, recording their every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU FUCKIN' RAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci puts his revolver to Rodriguez' head. Rodriguez,  bleeding from the mouth and nose, looks at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah... I am, I'm a fuckin'  rat... I traded you, Frank, I fuckin'  traded you... Simms knows everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci pulls back the hammer, ready to blow Rodriguez' h off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fuckin' shoot me, get it the  fuck over with! I DESERVE IT! I  FUCKING DESERVE TO DIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci is ready to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fuckin' right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci rips the wires off the recorder. Rodriguez closes his eyes, waiting for the end. A tense moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez opens his eyes, looking at Divinci, who is stil holding the gun to his head. Another moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm) Get outa the car NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then Rodriguez gets out. Divinci looks up at his  partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why you can never -- ever --  lose your sense of fuckin' humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car tears away, leaving Rodriguez alone in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: THE KEY
dialogues.text: Rodriguez pushes open the door to his apartment, enters.  Shuts the door. Stands alone in the room for a moment, th suddenly erupts in rage. Ripping off his coat, ripping of his shirt, ripping off the tape recorder taped to his che He throws the recorder on the ground. Stomps on it until  it's shattered into pieces. He stares at the broken recor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we caught you at a bad time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez spins around. Vic steps into the moonlight stre in through the window. Behind him is Cutless Supreme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we all have problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez suddenly YELLS and CHARGES THEM. He tackles Vic But in the darkness we can't see anything. Until the expl of a GUN and the FLASH of flames lights up the room. A mo of silence then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. You shot him, you fuckin'  shot him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men stumble to the door. Leaving one on the floor. Th door is flung open and Vic runs out. Followed by Cutless  Supreme.

dialogues.speaker: CRIME SCENE TAPE
dialogues.text: The crime scene is swarming with cops, DEA and FBI. The t of evidence collection in progress. Rodriguez' body on th floor. Agent Simms is standing over the body with Agent  Sarkasian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci musta figured it. I didn't  think he'd kill his own partner  though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEA AGENT Hooper comes up behind Simms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recorders busted up. But we might be  able to salvage some of the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him. You understand me, I  don't care what it takes. I want  that sonuvabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms heads for the door. Sarkasian and Hooper follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is deadly quiet. We PAN SLOWLY around the office until find Manny in his chair, sprawled back. Continuing to PAN until we see Cynthia sprawled on the couch. But no signs blood. Just the bodies. The door opens. TWO MEN enters. A we SEE are GUNS in hands. Cynthia and Manny wake up with a start. Manny is scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Who the fuck're you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BADGE comes out. And now we see Agents Hooper and Sarka

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Webb. We'd like you to come with  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia looks at Manny. She's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was the big secret? Shit. You're  an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia puts her coat on and heads for the door. Manny do know what the hell is going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is in with Agents Simms, Hooper and Sarkasian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who set it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Divinci wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one pulled the trigger? Divinci  or Rodriguez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Simms looks right into Cynthia's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Rodriguez is dead. He was  shot in the head last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets Cynthia's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodriguez was wearing a recorder.  Divinci found it. You can do addition,  can't you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell us what you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia looks at both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Divinci?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know. But we're gonna find  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna find him? (smiles sarcastically) Right... I don't know a fuckin' thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms stares at her for a moment, then turns to Hooper an nods. Hooper takes Cynthia's arm and leads her out of the office. When the door closes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a copy of the tape to Bailor.  But make sure it doesn't come from  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is alone in her cell. We HEAR footsteps. She look up as the GUARD approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your attorney's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What attorney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia enters the office. The Guard shuts the door. Cynt finds herself facing Arthur Baylor. A tape recorder on th table in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Cynthia. Please sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got nothin' to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur pushes the tape recorder and we HEAR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Take off your shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, you don't trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm askin' you one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna shoot me? Shoot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm sorry. You're right. I'm  fuckin' nervous. Like you. Forget  it. This thing... shit. Let's just  get it over with. I'll just feel a  whole lot better when she's dead.  Then we're off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur watches Cynthia's reaction to "when she's dead." B Cynthia has seen enough not to be too shocked by anything And her reaction is subtle. She knows better than to reve what she's really feeling and thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU FUCKIN' RAT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah... I am, I'm a fuckin'  rat... I traded you, Frank, I fuckin'  traded you... Simms knows everything.  Just fuckin' shoot me, get it the  fuck over with! I DESERVE IT! I  FUCKING DESERVE TO DIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fuckin' right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recording ends. Arthur shuts off the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you know my client is  innocent. That's all I care about,  my client. But I understand why you're  scared. You're already facing perjury  charges. My guess is, your involvement  is deeper than that. But I don't  really care, I'm not after you... I  get nothing if you go to jail. But I  think if I help you, I can help my  client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William -- Joe -- didn't do it, did  he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia hesitates, then shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then Cynthia pulls up a chair.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SIMMS
dialogues.text: angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No goddamn way! I'm not going to  grant that whore immunity. She lied  on the stand, she's protecting  somebody. And she's involved. I want  them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur, who was sitting across from him, stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I leave, let me remind you  that you have shit for a case. If  you really care about seeing justice  for your dead agent, don't blow this  deal. Immunity for her testimony is  a small price for a bad cop. It's  the only way she's going to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms glares at Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And William McCall walks, right now,  all charges dropped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simms hesitates, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If what she says is any good, I'll  deal. If it isn't, then nobody goes  anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is lead down the hall by GUARDS. They enter an of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents Simms, Hooker, Sarkasian and TWO TECHNICIANS are  waiting inside with Arthur. Cynthia is lead into the room The guards withdraw, closing the door. Cynthia looks at the men, then at the TAPE RECORDING EQUI on the table and the empty chair. A MICROPHONE is waiting Cynthia looks at Arthur, then sits down in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTERS swarm around Arthur and Joe as they exit the  courthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it feel to be a free man  again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Joe head down the steps to a waiting LIMOUSINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember everything that  happened to you? What are your plans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to go back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a surgeon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the signed confession,  did the police coerce you into signing  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, no more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get into the back of the waiting limo and it pulls a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan is in the back, staring at Joe. Arthur sits next t Joe. Nathan smiles. Joe smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to have you back, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'd like to make one stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limousine is parked curbside. Nathan and Arthur wait. Watching Joe walk across the lawn. He stops, looking down The grave stones are for his wife and two children. He si down beside them. It's very near where Agent Hudd was bur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giant party in progress. Expensive cars parked along the  drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with well-wishers in TUXES and GOWNS. Arthur Bailo and Elliot in attendance. Elliot isn't used to this much  glory, but he's taking credit where where he can -- with of the PRETTY YOUNG WOMEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you know, it just didn't make  sense, a man wanting to be punished  for a crime? How many times does  that happen? Once in a lifetime, I  can tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES to Arthur, who is also receiving his share o the credit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- to tell the truth, I had no other  witnesses to refute her testimony.  But she didn't know that. All we  knew was that she was reluctant to  testify. You look for signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And CAMERA CONTINUES TO Joe and Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, we thought you were dead,  you know. It's just incredible that  you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life moves in such strange ways. Oh,  I just think what might've happened  to you had you not been arrested for  killing that poor policeman. You  still might be on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe just takes it all in, smiling and nodding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, you look wonderful. After what  you've been through... I just can't  imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're ready to come back to  work, let me know. I've already spoken  to the board, they're ready to re- certify you anytime. I can put you  in the emergency sector until you  get warmed up. We all want you back.  We can't afford to waste someone of  your talent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then Joe smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK TUXEDO WIPES past CAMERA as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK SCREEN. We HEAR the POUNDING of the MUSIC -- a FAMI RHYTHM. And in GRAFFITI across the screen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neon blares as usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's Cynthia. Back bumping and grinding to the mus He life hasn't changed at all. And she knows it. But ther nothing else she can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door opens. Cynthia enters. Shuts the door. Tries the lig It doesn't go on. Suddenly a man is next to her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you had no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia tries to move, but a hand grabs her arm. And now see Divinci. He looks like hell. A man on the run. Desper and dangerous. He hasn't shaved. His clothes are filthy. looks like... Joe. Cynthia looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to do the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci suddenly shoves her hard across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why're you asking me that? You gonna  grant me three wishes? I don't know  where to start. Let's see... money  would be nice... love would be  better... but a little loyalty...  you can never get enough of that. (moves up to her) ...But we'll start with... money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci pushes her into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia goes to her closet, pulls out a box, opens it. It got her savings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all I've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci grabs the money and stuffs it into his jacket poc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll catch you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't have a clue, baby. And  you wanna know why? Because I am  following my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci puts aside his gun. And pushes Cynthia down on th bed. He leans in close to her. Face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they don't know where that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me about your plans. I think  I'd like to hear 'em now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci looks at Cynthia for a moment, almost with remors

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loyalty is what it all comes down  to. Nothing holds together when it's  gone. And once it's gone, you don't  ever get it back... You shouldn't've  told 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't've done a lotta things  in my life. But that's not one of  'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something... the  only difference between a liar and a  witness is that just one of 'em knows  what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark and quiet. No clue as to what's going on insid And we hold on this for a long moment. Just wondering wha she being made to do. And then there's a MUFFLED BOOM. Di exits the bedroom quickly. He is upset. We HEAR the DOOR  close.

dialogues.speaker: AND WHITE FEATHERS
dialogues.text: fall like snow flakes on Cynthia's body draped across the bed. The pillow on the floor beside her with the stuffing blown out. She has a hole in her chest, right above her h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny unlocks the door, enters his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the door and lock it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny looks toward the voice. Divinci is sitting on the f out of sight. Holding his revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared the shit outa me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more favor, Manny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when did I become such a good  guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm takin' some time off. I want a  car, here tonight, and a driver. You  can do that for your old friend,  right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Yeah, I can do that. But you are a  hot fuckin' potato. And drivers that  don't talk, don't come cheap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the money. Just put it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AMBULANCE races up to the EMERGENCY entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PARAMEDICS push the gurney down the hall. Cynthia is  conscious on the gurney. Looking up at the ceiling. She i fading. We HEAR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- come on, hang in there, hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CYNTHIA'S (MOVING) P.O.V OF THE CEILING and FACES. The gurney pushes past and CAMERA PICKS UP TWO SURGEONS m out of an Operating Room. Pulling off masks and rubber gl bloody from surgery. One of them is Joe. The other surgeo pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like riding a bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe finally breathes a sigh of relief and manages a smile

dialogues.speaker: BLACK LINCOLN
dialogues.text: pulls up in front of the office. Tinted windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny is looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leather upholstery, moon roof, CD.  What more could you ask for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci looks out. Gun in hand. He's cleaned himself up.  He's now wearing a Hawaiian shirt, slacks. A traveler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better not be a set up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to hold your hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just walk me to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lincoln idles at the curb. Divinci and Manny exit the office. Divinci glances up and down the street as they mo toward the car. Manny opens the back door. Nobody inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll let you live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a real prince. Now how about  my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci hands Manny a wad of cash from his pocket, then g into the back of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never saw me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I wish that were true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the door. The Lincoln pulls away. Manny watches move off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving. Divinci in the back. Can only see the DRIVER'S E in the REAR VIEW MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head south. Get on the interstate.  Don't break the speed limit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Divinci settles into the leather seat. Looks at the rear  view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, the one thing about life...  you can never lose your sense of  humor. Without it, you got nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the driver turns around, holding a 9mm and fires BLAM. BLAM. BLAM. Divinci's head snaps back as the BACK W BLOWS OUT of the Lincoln. And now we recognize the driver. It's Clyle D. Dunner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' A.

dialogues.speaker: THE LINCOLN
dialogues.text: moves right into CAMERA. BRIGHT HEADLIGHTS filling the sc The car stops. We HEAR the DOOR OPEN and RUNNING FEET. An PAN INTO THE BRIGHT HEADLIGHTS GLARING into CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: SURGICAL LIGHTS
dialogues.text: SHINING BRIGHTLY into CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- run the cardioplegia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faces appear. Looking down. We recognize Joe and one of t friends from the party -- Sinclair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fibrilating. Go on bypass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faces move away as we HEAR MEDICAL MACHINES in operation. NURSE reappears. CAMERA MOVES back now, revealing the roo And the operation in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forceps. (A nurse hands him  forceps) Just like old times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have done this without  you... I owe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky to have a donor. Never would've  survived the night. Have a suture  ready.
